just to draw attention to it. But I would stress that I am not arguing that peo-
ple do not have a right to life—quite to the contrary, it seems to me that the
primary control we must place on the acceptability of an account of rights is
that it should turn out in that account to be a truth that all persons have a
right to life. I am arguing only that having a right to life does not guarantee
